meanings.definition: To assign a task to someone outside of a company or organization.
meanings.sent1: The manager decided to outtask the project to a freelance designer.
meanings.sent2: It is common for businesses to outtask certain tasks to save time and resources.
meanings.sent3: The company had to outtask the event planning to a professional party planner.
meanings.sent4: Outtasking the research to an expert was like hiring a detective for the job.
meanings.sent5: She outtasked the difficult assignment to her capable assistant.

meanings.definition: The act of outsourcing a specific task or project to an external party.
meanings.sent1: Outtask can help companies focus on their core activities.
meanings.sent2: The outtask of customer service was a strategic decision for the company.
meanings.sent3: The outtask of the marketing campaign led to great success.
meanings.sent4: Outtasking the production of goods allowed the company to meet demand.
meanings.sent5: The outtask of IT services improved efficiency in the organization.
